answers.answer: He had a lot of illnesses besides hep c. He had a liver transplant in 1999. He had been in failing health for many years.
I heard.  But it seems like he had a fascinating, full life, even with the hep-c.wyn
Only 8 years post transplant isn't too thrilling to me. I'm hoping for better. But I haven't done any drinking and have kept most of my bones in one piece!
Wasn't implying that I didn't wish he'd lived longer.wyn

He also had diabetes and pulmonary fibrosis.I saw him at the Crystal Cathedral earlier in the year and he was struggling, on O2 and the whole schmeer, but he did die in a spiritually peaceful state, which i found a blessing.  He died at peace.

I thought I remember that he continued to drink after the transplant but I don't remember where I heard that.  He was a guy who wanted to live life on his terms so it wouldn't surprise me if it were true.Last nite on the news they showed the footage of the Snake River Canyon jump.  What a debacle!   You gotta appreciate his kooky spirit.  Evel was an American original, for sure.Anna.

question: Evel Kenivel died today at age 69. He had hepatitis C in 1999 from a transfusion.
title: Evel Kenievel
